meanings.definition: The quality or state of being seam-like or having seams.
meanings.sent1: The seaminesses of the fabric made it easy to tear along the edges.
meanings.sent2: The seaminesses of the dress were expertly hidden by the intricate embroidery.
meanings.sent3: The seaminesses of the situation were smoothed over with a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: The seaminesses of the city's underbelly were exposed by the investigative journalist.
meanings.sent5: The seaminesses of the old book added to its charm and character.

meanings.definition: The presence of unpleasant or sordid elements.
meanings.sent1: The movie depicted the seaminesses of the criminal underworld with gritty realism.
meanings.sent2: She tried to ignore the seaminesses of the gossip spreading through the office.
meanings.sent3: The seaminesses of the abandoned house gave it an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The seaminesses of the scandal were revealed in the leaked emails.
meanings.sent5: The seaminesses of the story left a lingering sense of unease in the reader.
